title: China Youths Swap City Dreams for Country Living as Jobs Crisis Mounts
description: Gong Chengqiang used to make 200,000 yuan ($28,000) a year in Hangzhou in a tech company before it shuttered during Covid. He now grows strawberries in rural Zhejiang province, and is expecting to lose at least the same amount after 40% of his harvest was destroyed by disease.

title: Biden Hosts Artists From Opera to Disco at Kennedy Center Honors
description: President Joe Biden spotlighted the arts as shaping “the very soul of the nation” as he celebrated the latest group of Kennedy Center honorees at the White House on Sunday.

title: Sunak Considers Spending Restraint to Allow for More UK Tax Cuts
description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak linked spending cuts and tax reductions for the first time, making clear the UK government hoped to pay for further tax cuts by controlling its outlays on state services and welfare.

title: Mexico’s Sheinbaum Taps Esquivel, Zaldivar for Policy Workshops
description: Mexican presidential frontrunner Claudia Sheinbaum on Sunday named former central bank deputy governor Gerardo Esquivel, ex-Supreme Court chief justice Arturo Zaldivar and former interior minister Olga Sanchez Cordero to a large team that will help put together plans for her potential six-year term.

title: Germany’s Habeck Cancels COP28 Trip to Focus on Budget Talks
description: German Economy Minister Robert Habeck canceled a trip to the COP28 climate conference and the Middle East to attend talks in Berlin on solving the country’s budget crisis.

title: Israel’s War Aims Move South With Hamas Leadership in Crosshairs
description: More than 100 hostages are free. At least 5,000 Hamas fighters are dead. Some 500 tunnel shafts have been destroyed. The Israeli military controls two thirds of northern Gaza. It’s a third of the way to its goal — destroying Hamas — and is launched on the next phase of bombing the south.

title: US Reviewing Options After Venezuela Fails to Release Detainees
description: The White House is evaluating potential consequences after Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro missed an end-of-November deadline to release detained Americans, National Security Council spokesman John Kirby said Sunday.

title: Biden Headed to Hollywood for Fundraiser With Spielberg, Rhimes
description: Hollywood celebrities including director Steven Spielberg, producer Shonda Rhimes, and comedian Rob Reiner are among the hosts for a star-studded fundraiser for President Joe Biden when he travels to Los Angeles on Friday.

title: Milei Plans Labor, Tax Reform in ‘Shock’ Package, La Nacion Says
description: President-elect Javier Milei aims to present reforms to Argentina’s tax and labor laws, political processes and potential privatizations in an economic “shock” package immediately after taking office on Dec. 10, La Nacion newspaper reported Sunday.

title: COP28 President’s Fossil Fuel Phase Out Talk Draws Condemnation
description: Sign up for the Green Daily newsletter for comprehensive coverage of the climate summit right in your inbox.

title: US Defense Secretary’s Israel Warning Is Naive, GOP Senator Says
description: Republican Senator Lindsey Graham said he has lost confidence in US Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin after his “naive” comment that Israel risks strategic defeat in its war with Hamas if it fails to protect civilians in Gaza.

title: Philippines Says 135 Chinese Ships Are ‘Swarming’ Disputed Reef
description: The Philippines’ coast guard on Sunday said it monitored more than 135 Chinese “maritime militia” vessels “swarming” around the disputed Whitsun Reef in the South China Sea.

title: GOP Negotiator Sees US Border Policy Deal Possible by Year’s End
description: The top Republican negotiator for a deal on US-Mexico border policy and aid to Ukraine said he’s confident that lawmakers can reach a bipartisan agreement by the end of the year.

title: US Says Warship Attacked, UK-Owned Ship Hit by ‘Rocket Fire’
description: A US warship, the USS Carney, and multiple commercial ships came under attack Sunday in the Red Sea, Associated Press reported, citing a statement from the Pentagon.

title: Foreign Terrorists Behind Deadly Philippine Bombing, Marcos Says
description: A bombing that killed four people and wounded dozens in the southern Philippines early Sunday was “perpetrated by foreign terrorists,” President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. said in a statement.

title: Germany Grants €700 Million for Northvolt Despite Budget Freeze
description: Germany will pay out €700 million ($762 million) to ensure a battery plant gets built after officials won an exemption from the government’s spending freeze.

title: Starmer Praises Thatcher in Move Seen as Bid to Attract Tory Voters
description: Keir Starmer praised Margaret Thatcher for delivering “meaningful change” to Britain by “setting loose our natural entrepreneurism” in a Sunday Telegraph column that quickly generated backlash.

title: Financial Stability Report and a Boris Mea Culpa: Sunday UK Briefing
description: Follow us at  @BloombergUK and on  Facebook, and wrap up your day with The Readout newsletter.

title: Israel Calls for Gaza Evacuations After US Urges  Restraint
description: Israel called for the evacuation of parts of Gaza where it says Hamas leaders are hiding, an indication it plans to intensify strikes in the south of the Palestinian enclave.

title: Modi Set to Win Key State Polls, Boosting Bid to Stay in Power
description: India’s ruling Bharatiya Janata Party is poised to win three crucial state elections, unseating the opposition in two of them, strengthening Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s party ahead of next year’s national vote.

title: Kganyago Sees 2024 Elections Among Top Risks for South Africa
description: General elections due in 2024 are among the key risks facing South Africa’s economy, said Reserve Bank Governor Lesetja Kganyago.

title: UK Will Pay Rwanda Extra £15 Million for Deal, Sunday Times Says
description: The UK government will pay Rwanda at least another £15 million ($19.1 million) to secure an immigration deal, according to the Sunday Times.

title: S. Korea’s Yoon to Reshuffle Cabinet as Early as Monday: Yonhap
description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol may replace as many as 10 of his ministers in a cabinet reshuffle expected as early as Monday, Yonhap reported, citing people familiar with the matter.

title: Israel, Threatened by Hezbollah, Seeks Solution for Empty North
description: A winding road in northern Israel lined with vineyards leads to Kibbutz Menara atop the Ramim Ridge in the Naftali mountains where pomegranate and avocado trees grow.

title: DeSantis’s Super PAC Reshuffles Leadership as Interim CEO Leaves
description: In the latest shakeup to Ron DeSantis’s presidential campaign, Kristin Davison will depart as interim chief executive officer of the primary super political action committee that supports the Florida governor’s White House bid, according to a person familiar with the matter, who asked not to be identified discussing the change.

title: Nine Dead in Peru’s Poderosa Mine After Armed Men Raid: Ministry
description: Nine people died and 15 were injured after a raid by a group of armed men in the Poderosa mine facilities in the province of Pataz, Peru, the Interior Ministry said in a statement late Saturday.
